title: How can a Northeast Indian become a Kpop idol step by step? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well this question actually matches my mentality. Must say that till xate none of Indians have been able to reach that profession. To be honest it is actually hard for Indians because in Kpop culture there are some strict rules which are required to be followed amd moreover it actually goes against our wishes. Just like …if you manage to be selected through an audition.the moment you become a trainee you have to follow their rules..the management would check your cellphones, they wont allow you to cause any kind of dating trouble…*No relationships like boyfriendor girlfriend*….strict diet rules.going through tough practices and disobeying their rules does follow severe punishments. Now if you find your self potential enough to not only crack the audition but also to follow such rules then i dont think there's any harm giving a try to it. In my personal opinion i do have such a dream but yes its mandatory..that your determination should be strong cause nothing is going to be easy if you get into it..especially being self dependent…Mostly your reason to be a Kpop idol should not only be a minor one like meeting your oppas and kinda impressing them….”NO” that wont work. If you have a strong determination you can go for it since talent matters.

It’s pretty hard for a non-Korean person to become a k-pop star and there will be some controversy with it, but I recommend: Learn Korean and all about the Korean culture.Find a agency that will accept non Korean trainees.Try for that company and if it doesn’t accept you, go to another.Tips: Don’t be discouraged if the agency’s don’t accept you, keep trying!If you can’t find any agency’s that will accept you, look for some opportunities to show off your talent.

That depends if you can sing, dance, or act. Then you are likely to get into one of the Big 3 or some of the other smaller entertainment companies. And if you’re willing to be fully committed to suffer as a trainee until they decide your debut date. After your debut, it’ll get a little easier. Some companies are harsh on their trainees and as a result, they leave the company to transfer to another. Or they just give up altogether. You have to have a strong willpower if you want to become a global superstar. And if you still decide to do it, then pursue your dream. No one’s stopping you.
